creditline: The Kenneth and Elayne Hengler Endowment for Art Acquisition, the William Hood Dunwoody Fund, and gift of Anthony d'Offay
description: horn-shaped object with a smooth wood panel in the wide end and a zoomorphic head and arms at the other; animal has an elephant trunk with tusks; arms are pulled into sides and hold small round objects
text: This elaborate ritual instrument takes the form of a yak horn. It dispenses consecrated substances such as mustard seeds, barley grains, bone particles, or even blood, which are loaded into the large end of the horn and ritualistically scattered through the mouth of the makara (a mythical sea creature). These magical substances are believed to bind or expel evil forces.
title: Makara-headed magic horn
